Type.Name: Screen

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Screen extends GLib.Object

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int raw) cil managed

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: The current active window for the screen.
Docs.remarks: Returns if there is no current active window or the window manager doesn't support the necessary properties to determine the active window.

Docs.summary: Raised when the composited status of the screen changes.
The default screen of the default display.
Docs.remarks: Returns null if there iss no default display.

Docs.summary: The default font options for the screen.
Docs.remarks: If multiple accesses to this information are needed, you may want to consider cacheing the result. The get accessor needs to use reflection to create the FontOptions instance and could possibly cause performance issues if called frequently.

MemberSignature.Value: public int GetMonitorAtPoint (int x, int y);
.method public hidebysig instance int32 GetMonitorAtPoint(int32 x, int32 y) cil managed

Docs.param: A representing the x coordinate on the virtual screen.
A representing the y coordinate on the virtual screen.
Docs.summary: Gets the monitor number where the point is located.
Docs.returns: A indicating the monitor where the point is located.
Docs.remarks: If the point isn't in any monitor, then the nearest monitor is returned.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance int32 GetMonitorAtWindow(class Gdk.Window window) cil managed

Docs.param: A whose main monitor is claimed.
Docs.summary: Gets the monitor that contains most of the given window.
Docs.remarks: If the window does not intersect any of the monitors, then the a close one is returned.

Docs.summary: The height of the screen in pixels.
Docs.value: A with the number of pixels of the screen.

Docs.summary: The height of the screen in millimeters.
Docs.value: A with the height of the screen in millimeters.

Docs.remarks: Indicates if RGBA visuals with an alpha value can be expected to have their alpha channel drawn properly on screen.

Docs.summary: The resolution for fonts on the screen.
Docs.value: the scaling factor from pango units to cairo units.

Docs.summary: A Visual to use for creating Drawables with an alpha channel.
Docs.remarks: Returns if the capability is not available. See for caveats.

Docs.summary: The width of the screen in pixels.
Docs.value: A with the number of pixels of the screen.

Docs.summary: The width of the screen in millimeters.
Docs.value: A with the width of the screen in millimeters.

Docs.summary: The current window stack for the screen.
Docs.value: an array of representing the window stack.
Docs.remarks: This property depends on optional Window Manager features. If the feature is not supported, an empty array will be returned.
